meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one millionth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the tiny insect using lymss.
meanings.sent2: The hair was so thin, it could only be seen under a microscope in lymss.
meanings.sent3: The ant thought it was a giant when it saw the world in lymss.
meanings.sent4: The thread was as thin as lymss, almost invisible to the naked eye.
meanings.sent5: The distance between the two points was so small, it was described in lymss.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to one millionth of a gram.
meanings.sent1: The feather weighed only a few lymss on the scale.
meanings.sent2: The dust particles were so light, they were measured in lymss.
meanings.sent3: The ant tried to lift the sugar cube, but it was as heavy as lymss.
meanings.sent4: Her burden felt as light as lymss after she let go of her worries.
meanings.sent5: The jewelry was delicate, each piece weighing only a few lymss.

meanings.definition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth of a liter.
meanings.sent1: The medicine was administered in precise lymss to the patient.
meanings.sent2: The perfume bottle contained only a few lymss of fragrance.
meanings.sent3: The tiny cup held lymss of water, just enough for a sip.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed in the room, filling it with lymss of sound.
meanings.sent5: The droplets of rain were so small, they were measured in lymss.
